Body:
The Helium Dev Board tech specs state that it has "Digital interrupt pads for I2C devices to wake the board". Does anyone know how many I2C sensor inputs in can handle in parallel? I'm not finding it documented anywhere.

"
I2C is a serial communication bus, so the answer about in  parallel" is: 1."
Right. Sorry. parallel" was the wrong word. "how many at once?" would have been a better way to ask it. Thanks for pointing that out."

Theoretically the DevBoard can handle 127 devices (based on addressing), but realistically with HW constraints in the DevBoard design, it can handle ~8-16 I2C slaves (depending on the inter-connecting wires between all of them). Capacitance plays a huge role in how stable the bus is. The Helium Extension boards are optimized to run several devices at once (up to 4 of each type) if needed.
